text: Alberto Cassano (23 January 1935 - 12 July 2014) was an Argentine engineer and academic. He was a professor at the Universidad Nacional del Litoral during most of his career. He founded the program CONICET. He founded INTEC and CERIDE. Cassano died in Santa Fe Province from a long illness, aged 79. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Argentine academics Category:Disease-related deaths in Argentina Category:Argentine engineers Category:Scientists from Buenos Aires
title: Alberto Cassano
